name: Photography by Tommy Ingberg
about:
Art by Tommy Ingberg - www.ingberg.com
Prints available at - http://www.saatchiart.com/tommyingberg

posts.message: Put this one together on the spur of the moment today.
This was nice and long awaited find in my mailbox today. I had the pleasure to have my art as the cover image and featured over ten pages in Austrian "The Modern Times Journal" from last month.
New work! "One". 50x50cm. Edition of 10. Info: http://bit.ly/2hkDfI2
New work! "Listen". Gicl’ee Fine Art, 50x50cm. Edition of 10. Info: http://bit.ly/2fxxKnU
New work! "Corner". Gicl’ee Fine Art, 50x50cm. Edition of 10. Info: http://bit.ly/2eWqoak

My work will be exhibited during the Goa International Photo Festival, a part of One Fest Goa Nov 21 - Dec 3. More information can be found here: www.theonefestgoa.com

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MwOVyV9Ouyc
New work! "Chimney" - see it in larger size here: http://www.ingberg.com/?Page=view_artwork&PID=60&ImageID=81

A series of pictures from my Reality Rearranged / Solitaire series was awarded 1st place in the "Digitally Enhanced" category of this year's International Photography Awards. I was also named one of two "Country Picks" for Sweden. I am a strong believer that you can't compete in art, but this recognition is special to me personally since these pictures are some of my last efforts in that body of work and also made during a turbulent time in my life when I had a hard time focusing on my art, and also did not feel very confident in my work and where it was heading. I've since then started a new journey with my new body of work that I am very excited about, and this award feels like a great end to the Reality Rearranged / Solitaire series.

You can view the winning entry here: http://www.photoawards.com/winner/zoom.php?eid=8-114751-16

The 2016 International Photography Awards received nearly 15,000 submissions from 103 countries across the globe. IPA is a sister-effort of the Lucie Foundation.. The Foundation's mission is to honor master photographers, to discover new and emerging talent and to promote the appreciation of photography. Since 2003, IPA has had the privilege and opportunity to acknowledge and recognize contemporary photographers' accomplishments in this specialized and highly visible competition.
